TI: Dissection of the hippocampus proper and the associated structures in preserved horse brains.
AB: The limbic system is a complicated region of the brain to teach in an undergraduate neuroanatomy course. The students often struggled with the complexity and interconnection of the structures of this system to other cortical regions. The following is a description of two dissections that used preserved horse brains to help students visualize the major components of this system and also comprehend the topographic organization of some of these structures to other regions or structures of the brain.
AD: Department of Biology, Winthrop University, Rock Hill SC 29733.
JT: Journal of undergraduate neuroscience education : JUNE : a publication of FUN, Faculty for Undergraduate Neuroscience
SO: J Undergrad Neurosci Educ. 2010 Fall;9(1):A43-6. Epub 2010 Oct 15.
